text: Soay (pronounced "so - ay") is the name of several Scottish islands. It is Sòdhaigh (sometimes anglicised "Soaigh") in Scottish Gaelic, and comes from the Old Norse so-ey meaning "island of sheep". It may refer to: * Soay, Inner Hebrides off south west Skye * Soay, St Kilda in the St Kilda group * The neighbouring islands of Soay Mòr and Soay Beag in the Outer Hebrides It may also refer to: * Soay sheep the native, primitive sheep from St Kilda ==See also== * Soa Island, south of Iona, Scotland
title: Soay
